AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.2008 Chevrolet truck: Vehicle pulling a flatbed trailer, registered to Daniel A. Huerta, outfitted with over-sized tires and after-market rims, involved in unsafe driving maneuvers, driven by Federico Saldana, used to transport a scissor lift to Dallas for repairs, suspected of carrying drugs, searched by Jason Cox, Gary Haston, and a K-9 unit, had a dog alert to the presence of narcotics on the floorboard, found with twenty four bundles of cocaine after a search at a tire shop, subject of a suppression motion due to alleged lack of reasonable suspicion for the initial stop, involved in multiple traffic violations including failure to maintain a single lane and unsafe lane changes, stopped on Interstate 35, recently registered license plates, subject of a consent search by Federico Saldana, involved in a routine traffic encounter, searched after voluntary consent from Federico Saldana, driven by Federico Saldana on the day of the stop, license plate registered in San Antonio on July 31, 2014, observed to have over-sized tires and after-market rims, traveled at approximately 75 miles per hour and changed lanes multiple times in an unsafe manner, stopped by Deputy Jason Cox, used to transport a scissor lift to Dallas for repairs as a favor to Daniel Martin Huerta, searched at a rest area, cocaine found at tire shop, driven by an individual unfamiliar with driving this sort of truck and trailer combination
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.flatbed trailer: Trailer transporting a scissor lift, registered to Daniel Martin Huerta, attached to the 2008 Chevrolet truck, being taken to an unknown address in Dallas, suspected of carrying drugs, searched by Jason Cox, Gary Haston, and a K-9 unit, found with twenty four bundles of cocaine after a search at a tire shop, license plate registered in Laredo four days earlier, searched by a K-9 unit at a rest area, cocaine found at tire shop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer: Vehicle and trailer combination involved in a traffic stop on Interstate 35, subject of a warning and registration paperwork, searched at a rest area, transported to a tire shop for further investigation where twenty four bundles of cocaine were found, witnessed veering onto Interstate 35 before the stop, owner gave consent to search, driven by an individual unfamiliar with driving this sort of truck and trailer combination, involved in a routine traffic encounter, subject of a consent search by Federico Saldana, searched after voluntary consent from Federico Saldana, license plates for both the truck and the trailer were newly registered, stopped by Deputy Jason Cox, used to transport a scissor lift to Dallas for repairs as a favor to Daniel Martin Huerta, cocaine found at tire shop
